headline: NiSource Stock Is Headed for Largest Percent Decrease In Five Months. Here’s Why.
summary: Shares of regulated utility company  NiSource  were headed for their steepest decline in five months on Thursday as questions swirled regarding the spinoff of a subsidiary focused on data centers.  Merrillville, Ind.-based  NiSource  provides natural gas and electricity through its Columbia Gas and Northern Indiana Public Service Company (NIPSCO) brands.  The Indiana Utility Regulatory Commission (IURC) is overseeing a proposal to create a lightly regulated subsidiary of NIPSCO called GenCo, which would fund capacity for data-center customers.

headline: Unusual Put Options Activity in NiSource Stock Signals Buying Opportunity
summary: A large, unusual volume in NiSource put options highlights the underlying value of the gas distribution utility stock. Massive volume in at-the-money puts could signal a buying opportunity in NI stock.

headline: Xcel Energy Rides on Strategic Investments & Customer Growth
summary: XEL boosts reliability and clean power with $45B investments, rising demand, and data center growth driving momentum.

headline: AES Advances on Strong Renewable Energy Buildout and LNG Expansion
summary: AES expands renewables and LNG operations with major solar, wind and storage projects, lifting shares 20.7% in six months.
